"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54518d02636872168c990100#post_54518d02636872168c990100
In one of the episodes yes. He also used that name in the official prequel novels. And there's another thing. Dante's informant in one of the novels is a fat italian guy named Enzo.
!img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20090929144739/bayonetta/images/e/e8/Tnenzo.jpg!
The same Enzo that shows up in Bayonetta.

Cuz think of it, Weapons in Bayonetta are made from monsters that turn into them after you fight them right?

Devil May Cry does the same thing!
